description: Conducting internal investigations including opening up internal walls (Listed Building Consent Application)
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.
REASON
To comply with Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence:
INV02
INV01
Heritage, Design and Access Statement - August 2024
REASON

To preserve the significance of the listed building in accordance with policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies 2022 and Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.

The scope of the works carried out shall be in full accordance with the Specification for Opening Up Works and other Investigations set out in the technical note prepared by Andrew Turner Engineering dated 24/06/2024 contained within the Heritage, Design and Access Statement - August 2024 accompanying this application. The extent of the works shall not exceed the scope of works set out within the technical note.
REASON

To preserve the significance of the listed building in accordance with policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies 2022 and Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.

Within 2 months of the completion of the works, the applicant shall submit photographs to the Council for approval in writing showing the condition of areas to be opened up and facilitate arrangements to allow for inspection of the works on site.
REASON

To preserve the significance of the listed building in accordance with policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies 2022 and Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.
Any damage caused to the building in execution of the works shall be made good to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the works being completed.
REASON

To preserve the significance of the listed building in accordance with policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies 2022 and Policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021.

For the avoidance of doubt the works permitted under this listed building consent cover only the opening-up investigations described within the Specification for Opening Up Works and other Investigations prepared by Andrew Turner Engineering dated 24 June 2024 contained as an appendix to the submitted design and access statement and does not cover the scope of any wider works beyond the clearly defined operations set out within this document. Any further works beyond this scope, including the proposal to form a wider opening within an existing cross wall at ground floor level as outlined within the Structural engineering strategy for new opening in ground floor cross wall dated 11th May 2023 would require a further application for listed building consent.

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (September 2007) as incorporated into the Hillingdon Local Plan (2012) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan - The Spatial Development Strategy for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies from the 'Saved' UDP 2007,  Local Plan Part 1, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.
